revised_title: Observations of the Solar Corona and Prominences During the Total Eclipse of 1893
tldr: During the total solar eclipse of April 16, 1893, J. Norman Lockyer and his team used prismatic cameras to study the solar corona and prominences. They obtained photographs that showed the spectra of hydrogen, calcium, and other elements in the solar atmosphere. These observations provided valuable insights into the structure and behavior of the sun's outer layers.
